intro: Alsodeia latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf alsodeia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Alsodeia latifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
